questions.question_text: What is the impact of selecting one Snowflake edition over another? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC - unit costs and compute credits

The Snowflake Edition that your organization chooses determines the unit costs for the credits and the data storage you use. Other factors that impact unit costs are the region where your Snowflake account is located and whether it is an On Demand or Capacity account:
Yes, finally 1167 question finshedcongrats!!! Don't know how many times I Need to go though 1167 question before exam.
you actually finished. congrats

Selected Answer: AC
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-editions

choices.A: The edition will impact the unit costs for storage.
choices.C: The edition will determine the unit costs for the compute credits.
choices.B: The edition will impact which regions can be accessed by the accounts.
choices.D: The edition will impact the total allowed storage space.
choices.E: The edition will set a limit on the number of compute credits that can be consumed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
Physical security is the responsibility of the cloud vendor we have chosen. i.e. either GCP, Azure or AWS.

comments.content: We are taking services from Snowflake so only snowflake will be responsible

The are not on prem though as you noted and the question refers to On-Prem. I'd argue all are correct as sometimes organizations do set up their own data centers and ensure security along with other operational aspects like electricity, water etc for cooling and maintenance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ALL TRUE

Selected Answer: BD
The correct answers are B. Patching software and D. Maintaining metadata and statistics.

Here’s why:

B. Patching software: Snowflake handles all software patching and updates automatically, which eliminates the need for customers to manage this aspect, making it a self-managed service.
D. Maintaining metadata and statistics: Snowflake automatically manages metadata and statistics, optimizing query performance without manual intervention by users.
Regarding the other options:

A. Installing and configuring hardware: This is handled by Snowflake, but since there is no hardware to manage (virtual or physical), it’s not something customers need to do, which aligns with the self-managed nature of the platform.
C. Physical security: This is the responsibility of the cloud provider (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP), not Snowflake itself.
So, the correct answers are B and D.

Selected Answer: ABD
Agreed
All options are correct

C Maintaining the physical security of a server room (key cards, door locks, etc.)
D Maintaining database objects

There is no hardware (virtual or physical) to select, install, configure, or manage.

There is virtually no software to install, configure, or manage.

Ongoing maintenance, management, upgrades, and tuning are handled by Snowflake.

Physical security is the responsibility of the cloud vendor we have chosen. i.e. either GCP, Azure or AWS.

BD correct ans.
SNOWFLAKE is a true self-managed service, meaning:
• There is no hardware (virtual or physical) to select, install, configure, or manage.
• There is virtually no software to install, configure, or manage.
• Ongoing maintenance, management, upgrades, and tuning are handled by Snowflake.

BD - As Snowflake is SAAS based, and Hardware and Physical Security doesn't come under SAAS 
Snowflake is a true self-managed service, meaning:
There is no hardware (virtual or physical) to select, install, configure, or manage.
There is virtually no software to install, configure, or manage.
Ongoing maintenance, management, upgrades, and tuning are handled by Snowflake.

comments.content: When choosing cluster size, SF will handle the hardware provisioning. SaaS is provided for end users, although it is SF's responsibility to take care of hardware, software, and metadata.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are correct

Selected Answer: BD
B. Patching software
D. Maintaining metadata and statistics

Snowflake is a cloud-based data warehousing platform that eliminates the need for customers to manage hardware infrastructure, physical security, and related tasks. These responsibilities are handled by Snowflake's cloud infrastructure provider, and Snowflake also automatically manages the patching of software and maintenance of metadata and statistics for its customers. Option A (Installing and configuring hardware) and Option C (Physical security) are not provided by Snowflake since they are handled by the cloud infrastructure provider.
So can someone help me which one is correct?

B and D are the correct options
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/intro-key-concepts#:~:text=There%20is%20no,handled%20by%20Snowflake.

Selected Answer: BCD
All 4
Snowflake "provide for customers" - doesn't matter if SF itself or Cloud provider. Customer has contract with Snowflake, not with the Cloud provider.

Selected Answer: BD
No physical security as it is cloud based and no hardware usage
As a snowflake customer, you shouldnt worry about if it is azure or AWS providing physical security. It becomes responsibility of SNOWFLAKE

Selected Answer: ABC
All are correct.
